name: Mohammed Noushir
bio: AI/ML researcher, innovator, and builder with a passion for agentic AI, multimodal systems, and real-world impact. Experienced in leading research, building startups, and mentoring in academic and industry settings.

education.title: Master of Science - Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in Science
education.details: Postgraduate study focused on advanced AI/ML techniques and their application in scientific domains.

education.title: Bachelor of Engineering - Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (Grade 2:1)
education.details: Undergraduate degree with a focus on AI/ML, graduated with honors.

highlights: Leading AI research and development on a platform for interdisciplinary knowledge discovery.
Developing modular agentic AI frameworks for research workflows.
Architecting scalable multimodal AI pipelines for academic insights.
Implementing explainable AI (XAI) and Agentic RAG techniques for LLM transparency and safety.
Selected (Top 5%) for inaugural AI business program.
Workshops with leaders from NVIDIA, Databricks, Box, etc.
Hands-on AI business innovation with $40K+ in enterprise tools.
Researched LLM tools for candidate-job matching in F1 industry.
Built and deployed custom GPT models for workflow automation.
Developed POCs for workflow streamlining across business functions.
Presented AI findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Delivered lab sessions for AI/ML courses to 60+ apprentices.
Mentored apprentices in debugging and ML project optimization.
Collaborated with faculty to align labs with industry trends.
Analyzed engagement data to improve course materials.
Led a team of 3 interns on advanced AI prototypes.
Fine-tuned Mistral 7B for prompt-to-code web generation.
Designed multi-agent Autogen system for travel planning.
Built a JSON Query Generator using Falcon7B, reducing manual data transformation by >50%.

achievements: Judge/Panelist for targetjobs' National Graduate Recruitment Awards 2025.
Best Startup Idea Award at QHack for AI innovation.
Selected for Self-Made Programme by TargetJobs.
Represented QMUL at Top London University Startup Mixer (LSE).
2× Hackathon Runner-Up; KAVACH 2023 national cybersecurity hackathon nominee.

projects.title: Computer Auditory Imagination
details: Gen-AI based Video Synthesis Model from non-linguistic auditory inputs.
Architecture: audio encoders, LLMs, video synthesizers for human-like auditory imagination.

projects.title: AI-Based Literary Style Transfer
details: Fine-tuned T5-based LLM for dynamic literary style transfer.
Built adaptive pipeline for style replication with semantic preservation.

projects.title: Low-Light Sign Language Detection
details: Real-time sign language detection in low-light using transfer learning and SSD MobileNet V2.
Used TensorFlow, Mediapipe, OpenCV, Keras, CNN, and custom datasets.

research.title: Computer Auditory Imagination: A Multi-Model Approach for Audio to Video Synthesis
details: Presented at ICGCPA-2024; published in Springer's 'Studies in Smart Technologies' (2025).
Proposed a novel Gen-AI architecture for audio-to-video synthesis.

research.title: Region-Specific Adaptive Weighted Multiscale Retinex (RS-AWMSR): A Real-Time Approach to Low-Light Image Enhancement for Sign Language Recognition
details: Invented a real-time low-light enhancement method for sign language recognition.
Presented at IEEE CVMI 2024; published in IEEE Xplore.
